page.title: 04Footpaths.
page.content: In Market Lavington there are many footpaths,some of which we have listed.One is called{Goatshute}because they used to take their goats there and tether them.There is one called {Little Hill}because it is not as big as{Lavington Hill.Periwinkle}is called that because it leads to a pond called {Periwinkle Pond.The Muddle}is called {the Muddle}because there was a mud wall at the end of it.One is called {Windmill Lane}because there used to be a windmill there.There is one called {Canada Rise}because of a connection with the Canadian troops.{Cemetery {Lane}goes past the cemetery.Only older people use this name,the lane is now called{Drove Lane,}perhaps it was once part of a drovers road.
